content:
I require a certain test coverage when implementing the project, but the current results are not very accurate. refer to:https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/91661

I wonder whether it was because some code was not instrumented when mir was instrumented, or it was instrumented incorrectly. So I want to print out the MIR of the code to see the effect of instrumentation.

Under my test file, run the command: rustc -Zinstrument-coverage -Copt-level=0 -Zdump-mir=test_file src/test_file.rs
This method can only generate MIR for a single file.

I want to know if there is a way to generate MIR for the entire project.
I want to debug the code coverage, is there any help? Anything is fine.
